intro: Benthamia praecox, commonly known as the early benthamia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Benthamia praecox is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in high-altitude conditions. Its blooming period occurs in early spring, adding a splash of color to alpine meadows.
